p: The chickpea seeds used herein belonged to the cultivar Blanco Sinaloa (Kabuli type) and were planted and collected in Angostura, Sinaloa, Mexico. The seeds were germinated with different Na 2SeO 3 concentrations (0.0, 0.5, 1.0 and 2.0 mg/100 g seeds) during four days at 24 Â°C and processed as previously described [ 2]. The total selenium concentration in germinated chickpeas used for this study was previously reported by Guardado-Felix et al [ 2].
